str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
This; he, she, it.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From skandalon; to entrap, i.e. Trip up (transitively) or entice to sin, apostasy or displeasure).
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To smite, strike (as with a sword), smite to death, afflict. Probably prolongation from paio; to knock.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A shepherd; hence met: of the feeder, protector, and ruler of a flock of men. Of uncertain affinity; a shepherd.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A flock (of sheep or goats). Contraction from poimaino; a flock.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From dia and skorpizo; to dissipate, i.e. to rout or separate; specially, to winnow; figuratively, to squander.
